title: TOP Tables
text: This is where you configure your tables for use by TOP. Press the + button to add a new row. Name In Imagine, a table is linked to a physical table using a name, which appears in the Table Overview Page (TOP) and the On-Screen Display (OSD). This name is known as the "Table Name". Description This should be a loose description of how you might reference a table. it could be based on general location or number of seats. TOP URL This is generated automatically when you save the record. This gives you the URL that can be used to access TOP to be embedded elsewhere if you choose to link to it from an external source. Clicking the URL will copy it to your clipboard for pasting elsewhere - for example encoding to an NFC dot. TOP QR Code This is generated alongside the URL. You can then copy the generate image and print it in whatever collateral you want to attach to your table, like a fixed menu or laminated sticker. Edit Amend or change any information. Delete This will give you a prompt below before deletion.
description:
This is where you configure your tables for use by TOP.



 Press the + button to add a new row.


Name
In Imagine, a table is linked to a physical table using a name, which appears in the Table Overview Page (TOP) and the On-Screen Display (OSD). This name is known as the "Table Name".
Description
This should be a loose description of how you might reference a table. it could be based on general location or number of seats.
TOP URL
This is generated automatically when you save the record. This gives you the URL that can be used to access TOP to be embedded elsewhere if you choose to link to it from an external source. Clicking the URL will copy it to your clipboard for pasting elsewhere - for example encoding to an NFC dot.
TOP QR Code
This is generated alongside the URL. You can then copy the generate image and print it in whatever collateral you want to attach to your table, like a fixed menu or laminated sticker.
Edit
Amend or change any information.
Delete
This will give you a prompt below before deletion.

title: POP Config
text: This is where you make any configurations for POP. Path This is the unique web address that you use to access POP (Point of Purchase) for the selected shop. It is used to validate the URL and must be unique for your shop and all tenants using Imagine. Pickup Available This will enable the ability for you to have a Collection order in POP. Delivery Available This enables the ability for you to have a Delivery order in POP. Delivery Item Id This is a unique code assigned to an item in inventory that is used to apply a delivery charge to the transaction. Without this code, it is not possible to charge a delivery fee. Free Delivery Threshold This is the minimum transaction value that must be reached in order to qualify for free delivery. Orders with a total value below this threshold will be subject to the delivery charge. Order Email Address This is where you receive notifications for orders that need to be processed, typically in the OSD.

title: Time Slots
text: Time Slots are used to allow customers using POP to determine a future time that they want to collect or deliver their order. Use Time Slots This needs to be On for POP to display time slots dependent on the configuration provided here. Order Processing Time This field is used to estimate the preparation time for an order and to generate time slots for pickup or delivery based on the given interval. For instance, if the preparation time is set to 15 minutes, the system will create a time slot every 15 minutes. Times These are necessary to enforce shopping within the designated time slots for customers. Throughput This is the maximum number of orders that can be processed during each time slot, which helps in managing the order volume during peak hours. For instance, on a Monday, if you have enough staff to process five orders every 15 minutes, then you can set the maximum order limit to five per time slot.

title: Kiosk Config
text: This is where you can change settings for the Kiosk. Hide Average Waiting Time ON Waiting time will not appear. OFF Waiting time appears at the end of a Kiosk transaction.

title: Languages
text: This is where you select the preferred languages to be displayed on your customer-driven SelfServe Apps, such as Kiosk and SCO. Imagine supports multiple languages, and you can choose which languages to display to customers based on your location's needs. Languages Pick which languages get displayed to the user. Default Mode You can choose the default language from your selected options. The default language will be the first one presented to the customer.

title: Shop Policies
text: The Policy Settings section in POP allows you to configure your FAQ, Terms and Conditions, Delivery Policy, and Return Policy. You can toggle the relevant "On/Off" switch to enable or disable a particular policy. Use the text box to provide the content customers will see. Once you have made changes, click Save to apply them.

title: SCO Config
text: The SCO Config setting allows you to configure the "Enable Out of Paper" option, which when turned on, will disable the SCO machine when it runs out of paper. If this option is turned off, the SCO machine will continue to function even if it runs out of paper, which could result in issues such as receipts not being printed. After selecting the desired option, click on "Save SCO Config" to apply the setting. A confirmation notification will appear once the changes are successfully saved.

After selecting the desired option, click on "Save SCO Config" to apply the setting. A confirmation notification will appear once the changes are successfully saved.

title: OSD Config
text: The OSD Config is used when the Order Display becomes backlogged with pending orders that may have been processed but have not been moved along the board, causing orders to become visibly delayed. Please note that using the Clear Down option will remove ALL orders on the OSD and this action CANNOT be UNDONE. Select which Shop you wish to Clear the OSD Board for from the list. Navigate to the OSD Config tab on the far right and click the Clear Down button. Warning: Once confirmed this cannot be undone. You will be asked to confirm the clearing of all orders, the warning will indicate using (Brackets) which shop you are choosing ensure you have selected the correct shop as this cannot be undone. Clear Down: This will remove ALL orders from the OSD and will not be able to recover them. Cancel: This will cancel the action.

title: Creating a New Shop
text: To begin making a new shop click the Create New Shop button. You will be offered a variety of fields to complete for your shop, such as the Shop Name, Group, Currency, Base Language, Manager, Shop Location, and Tax Groups. Note: any fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory, and the Save button will only become active once these required fields have been filled out. Shop Details Field Description Shop Code Identify the shop with a code, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Should shorter than the Shop Name Shop Name Give the shop a name, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters Base Language These are system available languages, select the most appropriate from the list Manager Choose one clerk marked as 'manager' from the selection here Image URL Link to an image for the shop Groups* Select the group(s) the shop will be in. You must select at least one group from this list so that a Primary Group can be selected Primary Group* From the Groups selection pick a single primary group. The shop will take any settings initially from the Primary Group. If a setting cannot be found then the groups listed in Groups will be taken into consideration Note: As a shop must have a Tax Group assigned you will not be able to Save the shop until the shop has a group assigned that has a tax rate set, or you select a Tax Group in Shop Configuration on this screen Shop Area The square meterage of the shop as a whole number Company Select a company from the list Currency* These are system available currencies, select the most appropriate from the list Company Number Used to display your tax registration number on the receipt. Can be letters, numbers or special characters Allow over receive of PO When the option is enabled, on Receive Goods that have a Purchase Order selected, you are able to over receive the quantity compared to the Purchase Order When the option is disabled, on Receive Goods that have a Purchase Order selected you are not able to receive more than stated on the Purchase Order Shop Location Field Description Address 1* Give the shop a first address line, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters City* Give the shops city, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters Postal code Give the shops postal code, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters State/County Give the shops state or county, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters Country* Give the country a shop is in, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 100 characters Phone1 Give the shops phone number, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 20 characters Phone2 Give the shops alternative phone number, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 20 characters Email Give an email address, can be letters, numbers and special characters, with a maximum length of 254 characters. This email address must be correctly formatted with an @ symbol and domain name. When given, this will appear as the sending address for emailed receipts. Shop Configuration Field Description Tax Group Where you have Groups and a Primary Group selected, but none of these have a Tax Group assigned, you must select a Tax Group here. Note: in order for an item on a transaction to have the correct tax percentage assigned, the transaction needs to know the Tax Group for the shop. For every item in Imagine, a single Tax Code from each Tax Group can be assigned. When the item Tax Group matches the Tax Group for the shop then the transaction can successfully record the correct tax due.

title: Editing an Existing Shop
text: If you wish to modify the information of an existing shop, simply click on the store name to open its details page. Here, you will find all the relevant information about the shop, as well as three options located in the top-right corner of the screen. Please keep in mind that deleting a shop will permanently remove it, and it cannot be restored. As an alternative, you may wish to use the Active toggle instead. Cancel Button: This will return you to the list of shops. Delete Button: Once you initiate the process of removing a shop entry, you will be prompted to confirm the deletion. After confirmation, you will receive a notification indicating that the shop has been successfully deleted. Save Button: Use this to keep any changes that you make. Inactive Shops: The Show inactive shops toggle can be used to show or hide inactive shops from the list. This is the only place where inactive shops can be seen. Inactive shops are not shown elsewhere, if you need to take action on an inactive shop then you must make it active first

title: Sales Budget
text: You can manage your Sales Budgets via this page. At the bottom of the page there is a Sales Budgets section. When you download the template, an Excel file will be generated containing all the dates for the current month, with a separate column for each store. You can then use Excel to enter your sales budgets for each store on the corresponding dates. Remember to save any changes you make, and use the Upload Budget function to apply your budgets. Once uploaded, your budgets will be reflected in the POS Charts. Please note that the budget will only be visible in the weekly and monthly views when the summarized button is selected.
